messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 3739
messages.messageBody:
From: "Robin Clevenger" <diamondair@...>


<<The only comment I ever got was from a woman seated
across from me on one of those Southwest airplanes with the four facing
seats. She said she thought it was "unnatural". Funny thing, her profession
was a stripper. Yeah, it's "natural" to pump them full of silicone and twirl
them around in front of 50 year old men, but not natural to feed a baby with
them? Yeesh.>>


Okay Robin I actually laughed out loud at the puter when I read this one.
You're funny. Thanks for the laugh and I definitely agree with you!

Mary B

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 3739

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 3739
messages.msgSnippet: ... and I ... no ... both ... and ... I ve never had anything but gratefulness shown from flight attendants when I ve nursed my kids (even at age 2 or 3) on an
messages.messageBody:
> When flying from Germany my oldest was 3 and my youngest about 6 months
and I
> tandem nursed on the plane. Was thinking I might get some funny looks but
no
> one said anything. The flight attendant even said how cute it looked,
both
> sleeping at the breast. I will say it is really difficult to be discreet
and
> tandem nurse, however. LOL
>
> Pam G.


I've never had anything but gratefulness shown from flight attendants when
I've nursed my kids (even at age 2 or 3) on an airplane. For one thing, a
breastfeeding child is not screaming, jumping on the seats, or running into
the drink cart, LOL. The only comment I ever got was from a woman seated
across from me on one of those Southwest airplanes with the four facing
seats. She said she thought it was "unnatural". Funny thing, her profession
was a stripper. Yeah, it's "natural" to pump them full of silicone and twirl
them around in front of 50 year old men, but not natural to feed a baby with
them? Yeesh.

Blue Skies!
-Robin-
